page.title: 03STREETS & HOUSES IN RUDGWICK
page.content: The{PREDOMINANT}area of housing occurs along{CHURCH ST.}and in a set of roads which branch off the lower half of the {B2128.}At present there are 11{ESTATES producing a fairly{DENSELY POPULATED area in the south of the village. The {NEIGHBOURHOOD}tends,however,to be{SEG- {MENTED}by the{RIBBON}effect of{CHURCH {ST.}Of the estates,{2}are{3}bedroomed terraced council houses whilst the others consist of owner-occupied,{3/4 bedrmd, det.and semi-det.houses. Many of the road names in the area have in- teresting connections:-{KILNFIELD ROAD relates to the local{BRICKWORKS;BRIDGE {RD}and{STATION RD}run parallel to the old railway;{GASKYNS CLOSE}&{TATES WAY take their names from two old{RUDGWICK families;{FURZE RD}relates to a nearby area of gorse bushes which once exist- ed whilst{ORCHARD HILL}is an estate on steep land once supporting an orchard.
